column5: Anyone else without power? Woke up about 3:30 and all was dark and starting to get cool. No power = furnace no work. Only heat I got is a one burner propane stove. Also with no power the water pump is out.  Rick
No interuptions here in south London. It's likely ice pulling lines down in your area. -Brian

Still plenty of power here in East York, but there's a heavy coating of ice on everything and strong winds, so it may only be a matter of time before the branches come down and take the hydro lines with them.  Just to add to the fun, it's raining pretty hard now too.

Power's good up here, but if it goes I'm ok, happens usually twice a year around these parts.  I use a wood stove, so I still have heat, and can cook, lot's of battery operated lights.  There are apparently several areas in T.O. that are out due to downed lined.  Be careful everyone.  Maureen
We're OK up here in Lindsay, light rain, -3 C right now but the wind seems to have died down.
Okay in the Quinte area the trees have some ice onthem making them look kind of nice this time of year. Hopefully there are not many trees down because of the ice.  Regards, Sam

Over 1,900 customers effected by this outage. Hydro One reporting they require replacing a pole to fix. Also over 3,000 other customers effected by other outages in they surrounding areas. Heres Hydro One's link for power outages. http://www.hydroonenetworks.com/en/about/o...s/south_map.asp  Rick
I was without power for a few hours in Bradford.....
pwer was on and off here all night in the shwa!!!
Coming into work at the store I have noticed that the western part of Belleville towards Trenton is without power.  Sam
Power was out in Courtice/Bowmanville when I left for work along Hwy #2.....  Jason

Keswick went out at 3:30AM, nice bright flashes in the east, was still out at 6:30 when I headed into the salt mines. Seemed that Thornhill and Richmond Hill had gotten hit sometime in the night as my wireless network to Mississauga was loosing packets almost as fast as they could be sent. By 9AM the network was purring, hopefully Keswick too
friend of mine lost power in Strathroy at midnight still off as of 3 pm today,get out the camping gear,Brian
Lost power in thornhill around 3 am - was still out at 11am when I went into the office, hopefully its back on now, was getting kinda chilly in the house.
We still have power here in Oshawa,   But I heard on the news this morning that Bowmanville is without power.
We're always in the dark in Sheffield.  No power outages though - tomorrow calls for more gusty winds and then Tues down in the deep freeeeeeeze again.

Well my power finally came back on at 7:30 pm last night. 19 hrs. without power. Oh well it could be worse. Some people's power in this area is still out. Now almost 42 hrs. and counting.  Best Wishes: Rick

How is it woodsman has no power, yet he can post msgs? "Ok I got one outlet on the generator what should I plug in.... Fridge...no,furnace...no,sump pump....no COMPUTER!!"  I take it you have battery back-up?
Lap top and phone line!

Exactly. Dial up here and I did not lose the the phone service. Laptop recharged by power inverter, powered by my boat battery which was in the basement fully charged. Inverter only puts out 2.6 amps max continuously. Too small to power anything big. Most people in the area now have there power back. Further west closer to Lake Huron there is still some without power.  Best Wishes: Rick
